title: Farm Machine Safety: Fueling and Daily Maintenance Safety

tasks.task: Fueling and daily maintenance on tractors and farm equipment
subtasks: Check operator's manuals for specific safety practices
Become familiar with symbols and colors indicating danger on equipment
Understand red color as a danger indicator (hazardous situations potentially lethal)
Understand orange color as a serious injury risk indicator
Understand yellow color as a minor to moderate injury risk indicator
Read all safety decals on the machine and follow instructions
Keep a first aid kit in each tractor or self-propelled machine
Daily check of fluids (crankcase, radiator, transmission) reported in operator's manual
Check location and purpose of gauge and controls in the operator's manual and memorize them
Follow correct safety procedures for refueling via operator's manual
Refuel tractors and farm machines when engine is cool and shut off
Do not smoke while refueling equipment
Exercise caution when climbing ladders to fuel tanks, especially on wet or icy steps
Minimize activities that could ignite fuel during refueling
Avoid overfilling fuel tanks and clean up any spills immediately
Check diesel exhaust fluid levels in tractors with SCR technology
Inflate tires according to manufacturer's recommendations (from the operator's manual)
Inspect tires for cuts, cracks, or bruises

tasks.task: Ensuring vehicle lights are functional and properly positioned
subtasks: Verify all headlights, flashers, and brake lights are clean and functional
Install two forward-facing headlights and a red tail light visible from 500 feet on left rear
Mount hazard warning lights or flashers in front and rear as required for public roads
Clean and adjust mirrors for good visibility
Ensure shields around the engine are securely fastened and in good condition
- Keep a first aid kit **(SUBTASK)** in all tractors and self-propelled machines.
